maml:description.maml:para: Connects to PortWise Policy Service

The Connect-PWPolicyService cmdlet connects to the PortWise Policy Service you want to work with. This cmdlet must be run before any other cmdlet in the module (except cmdlets that create new property-objects). The cmdlet only supports PortWise Password authentication. If this is not enabled in the PortWise installation, the cmdlet will not work.
The URL to the PortWise Policy Service (including protocol and port). Example: https://portwise.example.com:7443

Numerical ID for an authentication method that supports PortWise Password authentication. Click on the authentication method you want to use in the PortWise administration interface and note the ID. Example: 3
Username and password as a PSCredential object.
The URL to the PortWise Policy Service (including protocol and port). Example: https://portwise.example.com:7443

Numerical ID for an authentication method that supports PortWise Password authentication. Click on the authentication method you want to use in the PortWise administration interface and note the ID. Example: 3
Username and password as a PSCredential object.

maml:alert.maml:para: From the User Account web service help: "Manages user accounts within PortWise storage. The account services requires that the supplied subject belongs to a role that has been granted user account administrator and/or helpdesk privileges and that the accounts being administered is assigned to that role."

maml:description.maml:para: Disables an account in user store.
The Disable-PWAccount cmdlet disables a user account in the user store.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.
Enables an account in user store.
The Enable-PWAccount cmdlet enables a user account in the user store.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.
Gets an account from the user store.

The Get-PWAccount cmdlet gets a single user account (Account object) from the user store and wraps it in a PWAccount object. The PWAccount class is a thin wrapper around the Account class returned by the web service. This is mostly done to convert native types to .NET types (specifically Unix timestamps to DateTime and user certificate to X509Certificate2). It accepts as pipeline input anything that can be converted to a PWAccount: a string containing the user name, an Account object or another PWAccount.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the account with the user name john@example.com
Multiple accounts is fetched from pipeline input

maml:description.maml:para: Gets all user accounts that are currently locked.
The Get-PWLockedAccount cmdlet fetches all user accounts that are currently locked.
The type of account. Valid values are PolicyService or AuthenticationService.
The type of account. Valid values are PolicyService or AuthenticationService.
Creates a new user account in the user store.
The New-PWAccount cmdlet creates a new user account in the user store.

For PortWise XPI to accept the new account it must have the following properties: * UserName * Global Access * Notification Mappings (can be an empty array of MapItem, but must be present). This is not a parameter, but may be added in the future. All new accounts gets an empty array of MapItem.

But when you try to edit the user in the web interface, PortWise will complain if the following properties are missing: * DisplayName * ValidFrom (default = today) * Number of retries greater than 0 (Global Access, default = 9)
This is why UserName and DisplayName are mandatory parameters.
Specifies the user name of the account.
Specifies the display name of the account.
Specifies the e-mail address of the account. Must be a valid e-mail address and can not be null or an empty string.
Specifies whether the account is enabled (true) or disabled (false).
Specifies global access properties for the account.
Specifies the SMS number of the account.
Specifies from when the account is valid. Set this to null for no limit.
Specifies to when the account is valid. Set this to null for no limit.
Specifies the MethodAccess properties of the account.
Specifies the CustomAccess properties of the account.
Specifies the NotificationMappings properties of the account.
Specifies the display name of the account.
Specifies the e-mail address of the account. Must be a valid e-mail address and can not be null or an empty string.
Specifies whether the account is enabled (true) or disabled (false).
Specifies global access properties for the account.
Specifies the SMS number of the account.
Specifies the user name of the account.
Specifies from when the account is valid. Set this to null for no limit.
Specifies to when the account is valid. Set this to null for no limit.
Specifies the MethodAccess properties of the account.
Specifies the CustomAccess properties of the account.
Specifies the NotificationMappings properties of the account.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new linked user account with username john@example.com and the authentication method PortWise Password enabled.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new ChallengeProperties object.
The New-PWChallengeProperties cmdlet creates a new ChallengeProperties object that can be used to create a new account or update an existing account.

maml:alert.maml:para: Can be used in without connecting.

The New-PWInvisibleTokenProperties cmdlet creates a new InvisibleTokenProperties object that can be used to create a new account or update an existing account.

maml:alert.maml:para: Can be used in without connecting.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new MobileTextProperties object.
The New-PWMobileTextProperties cmdlet creates a new MobileTextProperties object that can be used to create a new account or update an existing account.

maml:alert.maml:para: Can be used in without connecting.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new PasswordProperties object.
The New-PWPasswordProperties cmdlet creates a new PasswordProperties object that can be used to create a new account or update an existing account.

maml:alert.maml:para: Can be used in without connecting.

The New-PWSynchronizedProperties cmdlet creates a new SynchronizedProperties object that can be used to create a new account or update an existing account.

The New-PWWebProperties cmdlet creates a new WebProperties object that can be used to create a new account or update an existing account.

maml:alert.maml:para: Can be used in without connecting.

maml:description.maml:para: Resets an account in the user store.
The Reset-PWAccount cmdlet resets the account logon retries for a given user in the store.
The type of account. Valid values are PolicyService or AuthenticationService.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.
The type of account. Valid values are PolicyService or AuthenticationService.
Updates a user account in PortWise Policy Services.
The Set-PWAccount cmdlet updates an existing account

maml:alert.maml:para: Calls the "update" endpoint service. The e-mail address is validated before it is accepted by the Policy Service. If it is not a valid e-mail address the command will fail. This property can not be empty and therefore it is not possible to remove an e-mail address from an existing account.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Changes the display name of an existing account.

Enable Invisible Token access for an existing account. If you only want to add an access method to existing methods for an account, it is important to first get the account and modify MethodAccess instead of creating a new MethodAccess object.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the link state for an account in the store.
The Set-PWAccountLinkState links or unlinks an account to/from a corresponding user in the directory.
Links the account to the directory.
Used with the -Link parameter. Forces an existing link to be overwritten.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.
Unlinks the account from the directory.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.
Links the account to the directory.
Used with the -Link parameter. Forces an existing link to be overwritten.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.
Unlinks the account from the directory.

maml:alert.maml:para: Calls the "link" or "unlink" endpoint service respectively.

maml:description.maml:para: Unlocks an account in user store.
The Unlock-PWAccount cmdlet unlocks a locked user account in the user store.
The type of account. Valid values are PolicyService or AuthenticationService.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.
The type of account. Valid values are PolicyService or AuthenticationService.
Removes an account from the store.
The Remove-PWAccount cmdlet removes a user account from the user store.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.
Identifies a PowerShell user account. This can be a user name (string), an Account object or a PWAccount object.
Creates a new GlobalAccess object.
The New-PWGlobalAccess cmdlet creates a new GlobalAccess object that can be used to create a new account or update an existing account.
Creates a new MapItem object.
The New-PWMapItem cmdlet creates a new MapItem objects (or several). The MapItem objects can be used with the CustomAccess property and NotificationMappings property (and more).

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates two MapItem objects with Username and Password.
Creates two MapItem objects from a hashtable.
Creates a new MapItem with one value and pipes it to New-PWMapItem and adds another value. This results in two MapItem objects.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new MethodAccess object.
The New-PWMethodAccess cmdlet creates a new MethodAccess object that can be used to create a new account or update an existing account.
